item.title: Gold Edges Up With US CPI Awaited
item.description: Gold prices ticked higher ahead of U.S. inflation data later this week that will shape the Fed’s views on interest rates, and will likely be a key driver for bullion prices.

item.title: Crude Gains After Volatile Week
item.description: Oil futures rose more than 1% in Europe following a volatile stretch of trading that has seen prices slump, with traders looking for fresh clues on crude demand this week from OPEC and the EIA.

item.title: Drop in German Industrial Production Worse Than Expected
item.description: German industrial output fell 3.4% in March, weighed by a decline in automotive production, suggesting weak demand as high interest rates curbed consumer spending.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Show Muted Reaction to Weak German Industrial Output
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields were little changed after data showed German industrial output declined more than expected in March, with ING commenting that “all German macro data in March plunged.”

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.7%, Dragged by Bank, Energy, Electronics Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in bank, energy and electronics stocks, amid continued concerns about policy tightening by central banks.

item.title: Dollar Falls as US Banking, Debt Ceiling Concerns Override Strong Data
item.description: The dollar continued to edge lower as concerns over U.S. banking-sector stress and debt ceiling negotiations keep alive expectations the Fed will cut interest rates soon, despite Friday’s above-forecast jobs data, Swissquote said.

item.title: AI Researchers Worry the U.S. and China Will Leave Everyone Else Behind
item.description: After ChatGPT sparked a frenzy among tech companies, a conference in Africa is focusing on AI’s promise and peril for poorer nations.

item.title: The Lies We Tell Ourselves About Multitasking
item.description: Our brains aren’t wired to juggle tasks.

item.title: The leader of Russian paramilitary group Wagner said he has reversed his decision to fully withdraw from Bakhmut, Ukraine, after pledges from Russia to provide more ammunition and operational freedom.
item.description: The leader of Russian paramilitary group Wagner said he has reversed his decision to fully withdraw from Bakhmut, Ukraine, after pledges from Russia to provide more ammunition and operational freedom.

item.title: The latest "Guardians of the Galaxy" movie tallied $114 million in domestic ticket sales this weekend, giving Walt Disney's Marvel Studios a strong but tepid start to the aging franchise's release.
item.description: The latest “Guardians of the Galaxy” movie tallied $114 million in domestic ticket sales this weekend, giving Walt Disney’s Marvel Studios a strong but tepid start to the aging franchise’s release.

item.title: Thousands of migrants have set up an encampment on sidewalks and alleys around a church in El Paso, Texas, ahead of a planned policy change by the Biden administration.
item.description: Thousands of migrants have set up an encampment on sidewalks and alleys around a church in El Paso, Texas, ahead of a planned policy change by the Biden administration.

item.title: Money managers are shying away from risk, turning to defensive stocks and Treasurys, but they appear equally worried about missing out on a potential stock-market rally.
item.description: Money managers are shying away from risk, turning to defensive stocks and Treasurys, but they appear equally worried about missing out on a potential stock-market rally.

item.title: The leaders of South Korea and Japan met as the U.S. allies continue to rekindle cooperation to counter aggression by China and North Korea.
item.description: The leaders of South Korea and Japan met as the U.S. allies continue to rekindle cooperation to counter aggression by China and North Korea.

item.title: U.S. sanctions are spurring Chinese tech companies to accelerate research to develop cutting-edge artificial intelligence without relying on the latest American chips.
item.description: U.S. sanctions are spurring Chinese tech companies to accelerate research to develop cutting-edge artificial intelligence without relying on the latest American chips.

item.title: Volkswagen CEO Oliver Blume, in his first major restructuring move since becoming chief last year, is expected to replace the management of the company's struggling software unit after it caused delays to new model launches, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Volkswagen CEO Oliver Blume, in his first major restructuring move since becoming chief last year, is expected to replace the management of the company’s struggling software unit after it caused delays to new model launches, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Some U.S. and European officials said they believe that Ukraine's planned spring offensive could pave the way for negotiations between Kyiv and Moscow and that China could help bring Russia to the table.
item.description: Some U.S. and European officials said they believe that Ukraine’s planned spring offensive could pave the way for negotiations between Kyiv and Moscow and that China could help bring Russia to the table.

item.title: Authorities are investigating a Texas shooter's possible links to white supremacist ideology, according to law-enforcement officials with knowledge of the probe, following a killing spree at a suburban Dallas mall on Saturday.
item.description: Authorities are investigating a Texas shooter’s possible links to white supremacist ideology, according to law-enforcement officials with knowledge of the probe, following a killing spree at a suburban Dallas mall on Saturday.

item.title: Natural-gas producers kept drilling even as prices plummeted last winter, a potential boon for consumers, who could benefit from lower electricity bills heading into summer.
item.description: Natural-gas producers kept drilling even as prices plummeted last winter, a potential boon for consumers, who could benefit from lower electricity bills heading into summer.

item.title: Arab leaders agreed to bring Syria back into the Arab League after more than a decade of isolation.
item.description: Arab leaders agreed to bring Syria back into the Arab League after more than a decade of isolation.

item.title: The Lies We Tell Ourselves About Multitasking
item.description: Our brains aren’t wired to juggle tasks. Remember what it was like to do one thing at a time?
